intro: Hieracium auratiflorum, commonly known as the golden-flowered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, giving it a striking appearance. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is often found in open habitats. Hieracium auratiflorum is a perennial herb that can spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
